children.subject: The professor could just be gone or less active over the summer. Your best bet is probably to find them during office hours during the fall semester.

history.content: +1 to Anon Helix. Even for staff, it's almost impossible to reach a lot of the faculty during the summer. Please don't send a lot of repeated e-mail requests. That will just annoy them when they do return and start reading e-mail. Going to see them in person is always the best way to ask for a letter.

Hello,

I requested a letter of rec from one of my past professors but I can’t seem to get a reply back. He teaches a huge class so it’s possible my emails are getting missed, but is there a way to tell if a professor is on leave? Is this information located on the EECS website? If so, can someone provide the link. If not, are there any suggestions as to what I should do to contact a professor instead of email because I’m sure the professor gets tons of emails a day. 

Thanks!
history.subject: How to tell if professor is on leave
